text: bret has become the second tropical storm of the 2011 atlantic hurricane season , according to the national weather service . as of sunday night , bret was about 100 miles -lrb- 165 kilometers -rrb- northwest of great abaco island in the bahamas , packing maximum sustained winds of 40 mph -lrb- 65 kph -rrb- with higher gusts . these winds could be felt up to 35 miles -lrb- 55 kilometers -rrb- from the center of the storm . not much movement was expected overnight , but the national weather service said it expected a slow north-northeastward motion to begin on monday . additional strengthening is expected in the next 48 hours , according to the agency . a tropical storm watch is in effect for grand bahama island and the abaco islands in the northwest bahamas . bret could produce 1-3 inches of rainfall and high surf conditions along northern - and western-facing beaches .
summary: bret strengthens from a tropical depression to a tropical storm .   bret is the second tropical storm of the 2011 atlantic hurricane season .   the storm is 100 miles northwest of great abaco island in the bahamas .   bret is expected to strengthen over the next 48 hours .
